revisions.rev:
{{main|Occupy Oakland}} {{Recentism|date=November 2011}} {{Use mdy dates|date=October 2011}} [[File:Oakland General Strike 2011-11-02.jpg|thumb|One of the marches to the Port of Oakland on November 2, 2011]]
The following is a '''timeline of Occupy Oakland''' (sometimes called '''OO''' or '''#OO''') which began on Monday, October 10, 2011, as an [[occupation (protest)|occupation]] of [[Frank H. Ogawa Plaza]], a plaza located beside [[Oakland City Hall]] in [[downtown Oakland]], and is an ongoing demonstration. It is allied with [[Occupy Wall Street]], which began in New York City on September 17, 2011, and is one of several [[List of Occupy movement protest locations|"Occupy" protest sites]] in the [[San Francisco Bay Area]]. Other sites include [[Occupy San Francisco]] and [[Occupy San Jose]].
Occupy Oakland was inspired by the [[Occupy movement]], which in turn was inspired by the [[Arab Spring]] and [[2010â2011 Greek protests|Greek]], [[2011 Spanish protests|Spanish]], [[2011 United Kingdom anti-austerity protests|British]], [[2011 Chilean protests|Chilean]], and [[2011 Israeli middle class protests|Israeli]] protest movements. A precursor in the United States was the [[2011 Wisconsin protests]] occurring from late winter through the spring. More specific to Oakland, OO was inspired by local protest history, including protests in response to the [[BART Police shooting of Oscar Grant]] in 2009{{mdash}}2010.
==Chronology of events== <!-- ===Pre-October 10, 2011=== * '''October 10, 2011''' â --> ===October 2011=== * '''October 10, 2011''' â Occupy Oakland began at 4 p.m. with a rally attended by hundreds of supporters, held in tandem with [[Indigenous People's Day]], both as a statement of solidarity and an expression that this action firmly situated itself against colonialism and nation states.{{citation needed|date=October 2011}} A couple dozen protesters set up tents that evening.<ref>{{cite news|last=Kuruvila|first=Mattai|title=Occupy movement in Oakland, SF housing protest|url=http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f=/c/a/2011/10/10/BA5T1LFU78.DTL&feed=rss.bayarea|accessdate=October 18, 2011|newspaper=San Francisco Chronicle|date=October 11, 2011}}</ref>
* '''October 14, 2011''' â Protesters participated in a short march from Frank H. Ogawa Plaza to the Oakland Police headquarters and back.<ref>{{cite news|last=Quintana|first=Sergio|title=Occupy Oakland holds short march during rush hour|url=http://abclocal.go.com/kgo/story?section=news/local/east_bay&id=8392891|accessdate=October 18, 2011|newspaper=KGO|date=October 15, 2011}}</ref>
* '''October 15, 2011''' â Around 2,500 people, including actor [[Danny Glover]], came out for a Saturday march and rally to show their support for Occupy Oakland.<ref>{{cite news|title=Organizers say thousands took part in Oakland rally|url=http://www.ktvu.com/news/29497557/detail.html|accessdate=October 18, 2011|newspaper=KTVU|date=October 15, 2011}}</ref> {{ external media | align = right | width = | video1= "[http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iYPn1tlRF78 Raw Video: Freed Hikers Visit Occupy Oakland.]" Compilation of scenes as Shane Bauer, Joshua Fattal and Sarah Shourd speak at Occupy Oakland.<ref name="AP teargas Oct.25th">{{cite web |url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iYPn1tlRF78 |title=Raw Video: Freed Hikers Visit Occupy Oakland |date=October 17, 2011 |publisher=Associated Press |accessdate=October 29, 2011 }}</ref> }} * '''October 17, 2011''' â On October 17, 2011, Sarah Shourd, Shane Bauer and Joshua Fattal â the [[2009â2011 detention of American hikers by Iran|three American hikers recently freed from an Iranian prison]] â made their first West Coast speaking appearance at Occupy Oakland, drawing an audience of around 300 people.<ref>{{cite news | url=http://www.mercurynews.com/top-stories/ci_19132953?nclick_check=1 | title=Freed American hikers speak to Occupy Oakland on Monday night | newspaper=San Jose Mercury News | date=October 18, 2011 }}</ref>
* '''October 18, 2011''' â Snow Park camp is established with about two dozen people primarily because the Frank H. Ogawa Plaza site was running out of room.<ref>{{cite news|last=Alston|first=John|title='Occupy Oakland' takes over a second park|url=http://abclocal.go.com/kgo/story?section=news/local/east_bay&id=8396951|accessdate=October 23, 2011|publisher=KGO|date=October 18, 2011}}</ref>
* '''October 19, 2011''' â The [[Alameda County]] Health Department visits the plaza on the pretext of "upholding public safety", specifically whether conditions were sanitary and whether rats that had previously been living in bushes in the park had been present in the encampment. No evidence was found of a rat problem within the camp. County representatives offered some recommendations but no aid.<ref name=Rats>{{cite news | last=Maher | first=Sean | title=Rats and drugs mar Occupy Oakland tent city, officials say | url=http://www.mercurynews.com/bay-area-news/ci_19139574 | accessdate=October 23, 2011 | newspaper=San Jose Mercury News | date=October 19, 2011 }}</ref>
* '''October 20, 2011''' â The City of Oakland issued an official notice to the encampment citing "violence, assaults, threats and intimidation", among other complaints, and, forbidding lodging overnight.<ref>{{cite news|last=McCleese|first=Tihanna|title='Occupy Oakland' protesters given ultimatum|url=http://abclocal.go.com/kgo/story?section=news/local/east_bay&id=8400403|accessdate=October 21, 2011|publisher=KGO|date=October 20, 2011}}</ref> The demonstrators "appeared determined not to leave" and countered that "the rats, drug crimes, and violence in the area of 14th Street and Broadway went unchecked before they arrived." <ref name=not_going>{{cite news|last=Fagan|first=Kevin|title=Occupy Oakland says it's not going anywhere|url=http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f=/c/a/2011/10/21/BA6S1LKNVB.DTL&tsp=1|accessdate=October 22, 2011|newspaper=San Francisco Chronicle|date=October 22, 2011}}</ref> The The grandnephew of labor leader and civil rights activist [[CÃ©sar ChÃ¡vez]] got married at the protest site. <ref>{{cite news|last=Johnson|first=Scott|title=Officials escalate efforts to remove Occupy Oakland protesters from City Hall|url=http://www.insidebayarea.com/top-stories/ci_19163740|accessdate=November 16, 2011|newspaper=Inside Bay Area|date=October 22, 2011}}</ref>
* '''October 22, 2011''' â Protesters marched from Frank H. Ogawa Plaza to Snow Park. Some protesters entered a Chase Bank branch and ripped up hundreds of deposit slips and threw them in the air, while some protesters stayed to help clean up the deposit slips. After leaving Chase, they protested outside of a Wells Fargo branch before returning to Frank H. Ogawa Plaza.<ref>{{cite news | last=Kuruvila | first=Matthai | title=Occupy Oakland shuts streets, defy eviction order|url=http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f=/c/a/2011/10/23/MNUU1LL5KR.DTL | date=October 23, 2011 | accessdate=October 25, 2011 | newspaper=San Francisco Chronicle }}</ref>
* '''October 25, 2011''' (5 AM{{ndash}}6 AM) â Police officers in [[riot gear]] from various [[San Francisco Bay Area|Bay Area]] law enforcement agencies cleared both Frank Ogawa Plaza and Snow Park in the morning resulting in over 102 arrests.<ref name=police_clear>{{cite news|last=Bulwa|first=Demian|title=Police clear Occupy Oakland camps, arrest dozens|url=http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f=/c/a/2011/10/25/BAUB1LLTC9.DTL|accessdate=October 25, 2011|newspaper=San Francisco Chronicle|date=October 25, 2011}}</ref> <ref name=police_clear /> {{ external media | align = right | width = | video1= "[http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CpO-lJr2BQY Raw Video: Protesters Clash With Oakland Police.]" Compilation of events as Oakland Police fire tear gas and arrest protesters marching through downtown Oakland en route to Frank Ogawa Plaza.<ref name="AP teargas Oct.25th">{{cite web |url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CpO-lJr2BQY |title=Raw Video: Protesters Clash With Oakland police |date=October 25, 2011 |publisher=Associated Press |accessdate=October 26, 2011 }}</ref> }} * '''October 25, 2011''' (4 PM{{ndash}}8 PM) â Hundreds of protesters and supporters gathered in front of the [[Oakland Public Library]] to march back to Frank H. Ogawa Plaza to reclaim the space. The march continued around the city for about two hours, and then moved in on the plaza. Police issued a dispersal order which failed to move the crowd, and fired [[tear gas]], and [[beanbag round]]s.<ref>{{cite news |last=Wollan |first=Malia |title=Police Fire Tear Gas at Occupy Protesters in Oakland |work=The Lede Blog |newspaper=The New York Times |date=October 26, 2011 |url= http://thelede.blogs.nytimes.com/2011/10/26/police-said-to-fire-tear-gas-at-protesters-in-oakland-calif/?hp# |accessdate=October 26, 2011}}</ref> Scott Olsen, a former [[United States Marine Corps|Marine]] and [[Iraq War]] veteran, and a member of [[Veterans for Peace]], suffered a [[bone fracture|skull fracture]] caused by a shooting [[projectile]] that witnesses believed was a tear gas or smoke canister fired by the police.<ref>{{cite news | last=Henderson | first=Peter | last2=Randewich | first2=Noel | title=Oakland protesters plan march, mayor apologizes |publisher=Reuters | date=October 29, 2011 | url= http://www.reuters.com/article/2011/10/29/us-usa-wallstreet-protests-oakland-idUSTRE79R5LH20111029 | accessdate=October 29, 2011 | quote=Olsen, 24, [...], was struck in the head by a tear gas canister fired on Tuesday by police, protest organizers said. }}</ref>
* '''October 26, 2011''' â More than a thousand protesters gathered peacefully at Frank H. Ogawa Plaza and held a general assembly in the plaza's amphitheater. They agreed to organize a [[general strike]] for November 2.<ref name="return">{{cite news |last=Bender |first=Kristen |title=Occupy Oakland protesters return downtown to claim Frank Ogawa Plaza |url=http://www.mercurynews.com/ci_19197518 |accessdate=October 27, 2011 |newspaper=Oakland Tribune |date=October 26, 2011}}</ref> The Oakland Police Department released a statement confirming the use of [[bean bag round]]s.<ref>{{cite news | last=Flock | first=Elizabeth | title=Iraq veteran Scott Olsen now in 'fair' condition | work=blogPOST | publisher=[[Washington Post]] | date=October 27, 2011 | url= http://www.washingtonpost.com/blogs/blogpost/post/occupy-oakland-veteran-scott-olsens-injuries-prompt-internal-police-review/2011/10/27/gIQAVrs1LM_blog.html | accessdate=October 29, 2011 }}</ref>
* '''October 27, 2011''' â At least 1,000 protesters held a candlelight vigil for Scott Olsen at Frank Ogawa Plaza.<ref>{{cite news | last=Dearen | first=Jason | title=Vigils for Injured Vet, Police Clear Tenn. Protest | url=http://abcnews.go.com/US/wireStory/wall-street-protesters-hold-vigils-injured-vet-14831926 | accessdate=October 28, 2011 | publisher=Associated Press | date=October 27, 2011 }}</ref> The plaza was re-taken by protesters in the evening. Mayor Jean Quan issued a statement urging non-violence and asked that there be no overnight camping; however, the city did not take steps to prevent the re-occupation.<ref>{{cite news | last=Bulwa | first=Demian | title=Some tents reappear at Occupy Oakland site | newspaper=San Francisco Chronicle | date=October 28, 2011 | url=http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f=/c/a/2011/10/28/MNHK1LN717.DTL | accessdate=October 28, 2011 }}</ref> Scott Olsen's medical status was upgraded from "critical" to "fair" by doctors at Highland Hospital, although surgery was still being considered in order to reduce pressure on his brain.<ref>{{cite news | last=Gabbatt | first=Adam | title=Occupy Oakland - police under scrutiny Thursday 27 October | work=live blog |publisher=[[The Guardian]] |location=United Kingdom | date=October 27, 2011 | url=http://www.guardian.co.uk/world/blog/2011/oct/27/occupy-oakland-police-live?INTCMP=ILCNETTXT3487 | accessdate=October 29, 2011 }}</ref>
* '''October 28, 2011''' â Documentary filmmaker [[Michael Moore]] spoke to a crowd of about 1,000 protesters. In the hour-long address, Michael Moore encouraged Occupy Oakland by saying, "We've killed despair across the country and we've killed apathy." <ref>{{cite news | title=Michael Moore: Occupy movement "killed apathy" | url=http://www.cbsnews.com/8301-201_162-20127435/michael-moore-occupy-movement-killed-apathy/ | accessdate=October 29, 2011 | publisher=CBS News | date=October 29, 2011 }}</ref> Dozens of new tents were erected in the plaza, including a medical tent provided and staffed by the [[California Nurses Association/National Nurses Organizing Committee|California Nurses Association]].<ref name= "Kuruvila 10-29-2011">{{cite news | last=Kuruvila | first=Matthai | title=Occupy Oakland: inspiration, frustration at return | url=http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f=/c/a/2011/10/29/MN951LNTGB.DTL | accessdate=October 29, 2011 | newspaper=San Francisco Chronicle | date=October 29, 2011 }}</ref> Pro-democracy protesters in Egypt marched from Cairo's [[Tahrir Square]] to the U.S. Embassy in solidarity with Occupy Oakland.<ref>{{cite news | title=Egyptians March for Occupy Oakland | url=http://www.nbcbayarea.com/news/politics/132802458.html | accessdate=October 28, 2011 | publisher=NBC Bay Area | date=October 28, 2011 }}</ref>
* '''October 30, 2011''' â Wounded veteran Scott Olsen's roommate Keith Shannon reported that doctors expect Olsen to make a full recovery.<ref>{{cite news |title= Injured Occupy Oakland protester should make full recovery, roommate says |first= Sean |last= Maher |url= http://www.mercurynews.com/bay-area-news/ci_19227978 |newspaper= [[San Jose Mercury News]] |date= 2011-10-30 |accessdate= 2011-11-01 |quote= An Iraq War veteran badly injured when police stormed an Occupy Oakland encampment last week is expected to make a full recovery, his roommate said Sunday. |archiveurl= |archivedate= |deadurl= }}</ref>
* '''October 31, 2011''' â Representatives of Occupy Oakland held a press conference detailing plans for the general strike on November 2.<ref>{{cite news|title=Oakland braces for Occupy movement's call for general strike|url=http://latimesblogs.latimes.com/lanow/2011/11/oakland-braces-citywide-general-strike-.html|accessdate=November 1, 2011|newspaper=Los Angeles Times|date=November 1, 2011}}</ref>
===November 2011=== * '''November 1, 2011''' â The Oakland Police Officer's Association issued an [http://www.opoa.org/uncategorized/an-open-letter-to-the-citizens-of-oakland-from-the-oakland-police-officers%E2%80%99-association/ open letter] to the citizens of Oakland expressing "confusion" about Mayor Quan's decision making. The open letter took issue with Mayor Quan's decision to allow public employees to participate in the upcoming general strike.<ref>{{cite news|last=Fagan|first=Kevin|title=Oakland police union: 'We are confused' by Quan|url=http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f=/c/a/2011/11/01/BAOS1LP3SB.DTL&tsp=1|accessdate=November 2, 2011|newspaper=San Francisco Chronicle|date=November 2, 2011}}</ref>
* '''November 2, 2011''' â Thousands of protesters gathered at Frank Ogawa Plaza to participate in rallies, marches, and teach-ins designed to empower citizens and to draw attention to economic inequity and corporate greed as part of the [[2011 Oakland general strike]].<ref>{{cite news|title=California protesters shut down Oakland port|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-us-canada-15568057|accessdate=November 2, 2011|date=November 2, 2011|publisher=BBC News}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=California protesters shut down Oakland port|url=http://www.guardian.co.uk/world/2011/nov/02/occuply-oakland-general-strike-live|accessdate=November 3, 2011|date=November 2, 2011|publisher=The Guardian News Blog|location=London|first=Matt|last=Wells}}</ref> A small group vandalized a [[Whole Foods]] storefront, and broke windows and [[Automated teller machine|ATM]]s of [[Bank of America]] and [[Wells Fargo]] banks in the afternoon.<ref>{{cite news|title=Occupy Oakland General Strike Shuts Down Port; Anarchists âBent On Creating Problemsâ|url=http://sanfrancisco.cbslocal.com/2011/11/02/general-strike-protesters-shut-down-port-of-oakland/|accessdate=3 November 2011|publisher=CBS San Francisco|date=2 November 2011}}</ref> {{ external media | align = right | width = | video1= "[http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CQl0g2Rqyfs CA Violence: RT footage from 'occupied' Oakland]" Compilation of events as Oakland police begin using tear gas to disperse crowds, while protesters retreat from the police line, treat those effected by gas, break windows at nearby businesses, or provide film interviews. }} :* '''November 2''' (11 PM){{ndash}}'''November 3''' (1 AM) â Later in the evening, a group of protesters took over a vacant building that once served as the headquarters of the Traveler's Aid Society, a non-profit organization that provided services to the local homeless population. Police soon arrived to break up the protesters gathered outside of the building. Some protesters fled while others set a barricade on fire.<ref>{{cite news|last=Loftis|first=Emily|title=Occupy Oakland shuts down port|url=http://www.salon.com/2011/11/03/occupy_oakland_shuts_down_port/|accessdate=November 4, 2011|newspaper=Salon|date=November 3, 2011}}</ref> Police used teargas and flash bangs to try to clear protesters.<ref>{{cite news|title=Occupy Oakland general strike â Thursday 3 November|url=http://www.guardian.co.uk/world/blog/2011/nov/03/occupy-oakland-general-strike-live#block-13|accessdate=November 3, 2011|date=November 2, 2011|newspaper=The Guardian|location=London|first=Haroon|last=Siddique}}</ref> Clashes continued past midnight. 103 people were arrested. Scott Campbell was shot by police using a [[Non-lethal_weapon#Ammunition|less-lethal round]] while he was filming a stationary line of police in riot gear.<ref>[http://www.cbsnews.com/8301-201_162-57321440/experts-occupy-vid-shows-excessive-force/ Experts: "Occupy" video shows excessive force]</ref> Kayvan Sabeghi was seriously injured while being arrested by police that evening.<ref>{{cite news|last=Gabbatt|first=Adam|title=Occupy Oakland: second Iraq war veteran injured after police clashes|url=http://www.guardian.co.uk/world/2011/nov/04/occupy-oakland-second-veteran-injured|accessdate=November 6, 2011|newspaper=The Guardian|date=November 4, 2011|location=London}}</ref>
* '''November 3''' â After 18 hours of being denied medical treatment while in police custody, Kayvan Sabeghi was transferred to [[Highland Hospital (Oakland, California)|Highland Hospital]] and put into the intensive care unit.<ref name=kayvan_reuters>{{cite news|last=Randewich|first=Noel|title=Army veteran injured in Oakland clashes with police|url=http://www.reuters.com/article/2011/11/05/us-protests-oakland-veteran-idUSTRE7A37A820111105|accessdate=6 November 2011|newspaper=Reuters|date=4 November 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Kayvan Sabeghi Injured: Second Iraq war vet hurt during Oakland clash with police|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2011/11/05/kayvan-sabeghi-injured_n_1077806.html|accessdate=5 November 2011|newspaper=Huffington Post|date=5 November 2011}}</ref> Journalist Susie Cagle was arrested in the early hours of November 3, jailed, and ultimately charged with a misdemeanor. Cagle subsequently reported having observed mistreatment of protesters during their imprisonment.<ref>[http://www.alternet.org/story/152990/police_state_in_oakland_one_reporter%27s_arrest_contradicts_official_story/?page=entire]</ref> The [[Oakland Metropolitan Chamber of Commerce]] issued a [http://www.scribd.com/doc/71505592/Chamber-of-Commerce-Response-to-Proposed-Resolution-Letter letter] calling for the eviction of the protestors.
* '''November 4''' â The Oakland City Council held a five hour meeting to consider a resolution by council member [[Nancy Nadel]] in support of the Occupy Oakland encampment. The council heard over 100 people speak about the positives and negatives of Occupy Oakland. Oakland Metropolitan Chamber of Commerce President [[Joe Haraburda]] said,"We have made our position clear.â¦ We want Occupy Oakland closed."<ref>[http://articles.latimes.com/2011/nov/04/local/la-me-occupy-oakland-20111104 Occupy Oakland debated at public forum]</ref> The vote on the resolution was postponed until the November 15 city council meeting.<ref>{{cite news|title=Tense Meeting Reveals Deep Divisions over Occupy Oakland|url=http://www.baycitizen.org/occupy-movement/story/tense-meeting-reveals-deep-divisions/|accessdate=November 5, 2011|publisher=The Bay Citizen|date=November 4, 2011}}</ref>
* '''November 5''' â A downtown Oakland Wells Fargo branch closed for business because of the roughly 100 immigrant rights protesters who marched from Occupy Oakland's encampment to protest the bank's connection to companies that run [[Immigration detention in the United States|immigrant detention centers]].<ref>{{cite news|last=Wohlsen|first=Marcus|title=Protesters close down Oakland Wells Fargo branch|url=http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f=/n/a/2011/11/05/state/n134250D33.DTL|accessdate=November 5, 2011|newspaper=AP - San Francisco Chronicle|date=November 5, 2011}}</ref>
* '''November 7''' â Occupy Oakland deposited $20,000 donated by Occupy Wall Street for urgent medical and legal expenses into Wells Fargo. The Occupy Oakland general assembly approved the decision to hold it temporarily in a Wells Fargo account so that it could begin being used immediately while the group waits on the state to finalize its status as an unincorporated association able to hold funds.<ref>[http://www.sfexaminer.com/local/2011/11/occupy-oakland-makes-20k-deposit-wells-fargo Occupy Oakland makes $20K deposit at Wells Fargo], San Francisco Examiner, November 8, 2011</ref><ref>[http://www.occupyoakland.org/generalassembly/committees/ Occupy Oakland General Assembly statement on $20,000 donation]</ref><ref>[http://sanfrancisco.cbslocal.com/2011/11/09/occupy-oakland-protesters-deposit-funds-at-wells-fargo-after-bank-attacks/ Occupy Oakland Protesters Deposit Funds At Wells Fargo After Bank Attacks], CBS News, November 9, 2011</ref><ref>[http://abclocal.go.com/kgo/story?section=news/local/east_bay&id=8425918 'Occupy Oakland' opens bank account at Wells Fargo], ABC News, November 9, 2011</ref>
* '''November 9''' â Five members of the Oakland City Council, two dozen clergy and some local small business owners held a press conference calling for the immediate eviction of Occupy Oakland. Occupy protesters interrupted Larry Reid's speech with chants. The council members and business owners responded with their own chants.<ref>Kuruvila, Matthai [http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f=/c/a/2011/11/09/BAH61LSRPF.DTL Occupy protesters shout down Oakland council] ''San Francisco Chronicle'' November 9, 2011</ref> Jean Quan held a meeting with the remaining protesters at Frank Ogawa Plaza.<ref>Hollyfield, Amy [http://abclocal.go.com/kgo/story?section=news/local/east_bay&id=8424668 Protesters, city headed for showdown in Oakland] ''ABC KGO 7'' November 9, 2011</ref> Occupy Oakland general assembly voted to "withdraw a resolution calling for future demonstrators to remain peaceful."<ref>[http://abclocal.go.com/kgo/story?section=news/local/east_bay&id=8427150 Protesters withdraw resolution to remain peaceful], ABC News, November 10, 2011</ref> Law enforcement attempted to evict the members of OccupyCal from their encampment on the UC Berkeley campus. Members of Occupy Oakland joined in the Berkeley protest.
* '''November 10''' â A man was fatally shot near the Frank Ogawa Plaza encampment. <ref>{{cite news|title=Shots fired near 'Occupy Oakland,' one dead|url=http://abclocal.go.com/kgo/story?section=news/local/east_bay&id=8427634|accessdate=November 10, 2011|newspaper=KGO-TV|date=November 13, 2011}}</ref>
* '''November 11''' â The Oakland Police Officers Association release an open letter to Occupy Oakland stating that "it is time to go home." <ref>{{cite news|title=Oakland police union calls for end to "Occupy" camp|url=http://www.reuters.com/article/2011/11/11/us-protests-oakland-idUSTRE7AA53020111111|accessdate=November 13, 2011|newspaper=Reuters|date=November 11, 2011|first=Steve|last=Gorman}}</ref> Oakland Police issue eviction notices to the demonstrators at the tent encampment. Veterans march and rally in downtown Oakland against police brutality.<ref>{{cite news|last=Woodall|first=Angela|title=Oakland police issue evictions notices at Occupy Oakland|url=http://www.mercurynews.com/occupy-oakland/ci_19319305?source=rss|accessdate=November 13, 2011|newspaper=Oakland Tribune|date=November 12, 2011}}</ref>
* '''November 13''' â The November 10 shooting victim is identified. 25-year-old Kayode Ola Foster had been staying at Occupy Oakland in the days leading up to the shooting.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://latimesblogs.latimes.com/lanow/2011/11/shooting-victim-tied-to-occupy-oakland.html |title=Shooting victim is tied to Occupy Oakland |last=Romney |first=Lee |date=November 13, 2011 |work=Los Angeles Times}}</ref>
* '''November 14''' â Hundreds of law enforcement officers clear the plaza for a second time. Mayor Jean Quan's city hall Legal Adviser, [[Daniel Mark Siegel|Dan Siegel]] and Oakland Deputy Mayor [[Sharon Cornu]] resign.<ref name=Liveblog>{{cite web|last=Bender|first=Kristin J.|title=Occupy Oakland Live Blog: Police outnumber protesters at Ogawa plaza|url=http://www.mercurynews.com/occupy-oakland/ci_19331752|publisher=Mercury News|accessdate=16 November 2011|author=Josh Richman, Thomas Peele and Sean Maher|month=November|year=2011}}</ref>
* '''November 21''' - Police clear out final remaining Occupy Oakland encampment at Snow Park. The movement was left with no physical presence occupying any public space overnight in the city of Oakland. <ref name=sfsnowpark>{{cite news|last=Kane|first=Will|title=Police clear out last Occupy Oakland camp|url=http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f=/c/a/2011/11/21/BAO61M24MU.DTL|accessdate=November 21, 2011|newspaper=San Francisco Chronicle|date=November 21, 2011}}</ref>
